programme.title: Ubudiah Royal Mosque, Malaysia
programme.desc: While Malaysia is a complete package for every sort of tourist, a long list of landmarks that are clearly steeped in Malaysian heritage appeals particularly all lovers of history. Ubudiah Mosque is one of them. It remains as one of the Malaysia's most treasured historical landmarks. It is indeed a great symbolism of the Islamic Architecture, by its Mogul-influenced structure, with golden dome and numerous minarets, together with the arches...

programme.title: Bikur Holim Synagogue, Turkey
programme.desc: Bikur Holim Synagogue was built in 1724 by Salamon de Ciaves, a Dutch-born Jew from Izmir. The houses and shops adjacent to the building were financially attached to the synagogue to generate income.

programme.title: Kencho-ji, Japan
programme.desc: Today we are in Kamakura, a small city in the Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. This region is part of greater Tokyo, only a 60-minute train journey from Shinjuku station. It is here that we will discover the great Kencho-ji Temple.

programme.title: Savoy Castle, Aosta Valley, Italy
programme.desc: Just outside Gressoney-Saint-Jean, a little mountain village in the Aosta Valley in Italy, is Queen Margherita&apos s fairy tale summer residence: the Savoy Castle. Like in any fairytale, the turrets of this early 20th century dwelling emerge from the surrounding woodland. Thanks to Margherita of Savoy, spouse of Umberto I and Queen of Italy, between the end of the 19th and the beginning of the 20th century, Gressoney became one of the favorite holiday localities to be frequented by the nobility.

programme.title: Ruins of Bridgettine Convent
programme.desc: The ruins rising above the Pirita River banks date back to 1407, when the largest nunnery in Old Livonia was founded here. The convent that got its name from St. Birgitta, who founded the mother convent in Sweden, survived in its original form until 1577 "& "when Ivan the Terrible destroyed it. At the end of the last century, several extensive excavation and conservation projects took place on the medieval convent premises. The massive façade, walls, cellars, and graveyard have survived until the present.

programme.title: Trapezitsa Fortress
programme.desc: The fortress on Trapezitsa was built somewhere in XIII century and during the Second Bulgarian kingdom there were housed the main church buildings of the capital city, the Patriarchate and the Patriarch`s residence. In the past, the high walls of the fort"& "ification were rising on the steep rocks.

programme.title: Mar Saba Monastery, Palestinian Territories
programme.desc: The Holy Lavra of Saint Sabbas, known in Syriac as Mar Saba, is a Greek Orthodox monastery overlooking the Kidron Valley at a point halfway between the Old City of Jerusalem and the Dead Sea, within the Bethlehem Governorate of the West Bank.

programme.title: The Good Samaritan Museum
programme.desc: On the road from Jerusalem to the Dead Sea, discover the Good Samaritain Museum, an archaeological and historical site. This museum, which is the only mosaic museum in the country and one of only three in the world, has artefacts which were unearthed in J"& "udea, Samaria and Gaza on display. You are in the area of Ma'ale Adumim (Red Heights), on the same road that pilgrims used to take on their way to Jerusalem, particularly those coming from the Galilee via the Jordan Valley and Jericho, in the footsteps of"& " Jesus and John the Baptist…

programme.title: Coptic Church of the Annunciation, Israel
The Franja Partisan Hospital, Slovenia
programme.desc: Franja Partisan Hospital was a secret World War II hospital at Dolenji Novaki near Cerkno in western Slovenia. It was run by the Slovene Partisans from December 1943 until the end of the war.

programme.title: Traveling With Denella Ri&apos chard
programme.desc: Port St. Lucie, the jewel of the Treasure Coast of Florida. In this episode, travel expert, Denella Ri'chard, explores heritage trails rooted in history and family fun. programme.title: Quark Expeditions: Vacation Of A Lifetime: The Polar Regions
programme.desc: Denella Ri&apos chard and Quark Expeditions, the leader in polar adventures, take the trip of a lifetime in the Polar regions.

programme.title: Antalya City, Turkey
programme.desc: We are on the Turkish Riviera, in the city of Antalya. It is the fifth most populous city in Turkey and the capital of Antalya province. Located on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, it is a city redolent of age, there are sites with traces of Hellenistic, Roman, Byzantine, Seljuk, and Ottoman architecture.

programme.title: Saschiz Old Town, Romania
programme.desc: The villages of Saschiz, Mihai Viteazu, and Cloașterf make up the larger commune of Saschiz. First documented in the 14th century, Saschiz is known for its medieval fortress and church constructed by Transylvanian Saxons, a German speaker. Along with five other villages with fortified churches, Saschiz was inscribed on UNESCO's World Heritage sites in 1999.

programme.title: Traveling With Denella Ri&apos chard

programme.title: Sassi di Matera, Italy
programme.desc: Between the toe and heel of Southern Italy, there is the Basilicata region. This mountainous and arid landscape of the area has ensured a relatively sparse population and only in recent years has local infrastructure been developed. One of the larger population centers in this remote area is the unique and spectacular City of Sassi di Matera.
